channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree damaged due to car accident, 19th October
item.description:
A tree has been damaged due to car accident. Debris everywhere

item.title: Blocked street drain, flood risk, 19th October
item.description:
The street drains on Brixton water lane near brockwell park are blocked with soil and grass and rubbish, which as the heavier rains from sitting storms come could lead to surface water flooding

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brixton Water Lane, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipping Corner, 19th October
item.description:
Fly-tipping continues to occur regularly at Anglesea Avenue. Despite previous cleanups, the problem keeps returning. I’m asking the Council to take real preventive measures, such as installing CCTV, clear warning signs, or regular patrols, to stop this from happening again. Residents are frustrated — please treat this as a recurring issue, not a one-time cleanup.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anglesea Mews, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bike blocking path, 19th October
item.description:
Lime bike deliberately parked in the middle of the path near 23-25 Cator Road blocking it for wheelchair users, buggies, as well as inconveniencing pedestrians. Bike number in photo.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cator Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No 'Wildflower' designation posts. Tree branches need cutting back as they are obscuring a number of foot/cycle path lamps which is resulting in very poor lit dangerous path along this section. Please cut back the tree branches so the lamps shine on the foot/cycle path., 19th October
item.description:
No 'Wildflower' designation posts. Tree branches need cutting back as they are obscuring a number of foot/cycle path lamps which is resulting in very poor lit dangerous path along this section. Please cut back the tree branches so the lamps shine on the foot/cycle path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidcup By-pass, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass, litter and debris, 19th October
